quotes.quote: When you're good at making excuses, it's hard to excel at anything else.
Several excuses are always less convincing than one.
The best excuse is to have none.
Once your excuses are gone, you will simply have to settle for being awesome!
Excuses are the tools with which persons with no purpose in view build for themselves great monuments of nothing.
He that is good for making excuses is seldom good for anything else.
He who excuses himself accuses himself.
Ninety-nine percent of the failures come from people who have the habit of making excuses.
The real man is one who always finds excuses for others, but never excuses himself.
Don't make excuses, make something incredible happen in your life right now.
Never make excuses. Your friends don't need them and your foes won't believe them.
Don't make excuses. Make things happen. Make changes. Then make history.
Put all excuses aside and remember this: YOU are capable.
Do you find yourself making excuses when you do not perform? Shed the excuses and face reality. Excuses are the loser's way out. They will mar your credibility and stunt your personal growth.
You can make excuses or you can make progress. You choose.
Excuses change nothing, but make everyone feel better.
The origin of every excuse is the failure to do something.
Excuses, are nothing more, than a reason to fail.
Don't make excuses make good.
An excuse is worse and more terrible than a lie; for an excuse is a lie guarded.
A life that is defended by Excuses has become comfortable in defeat, it has settled for mediocrity and is destined for failure.
Don't look for excuses to lose. Look for excuses to win.
An excuse is a skin of a reason stuffed with a lie.
It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
An excuse becomes an obstacle in your journey to success when it is made in place of your best effort or when it is used as the object of the blame.
Any excuse will serve a tyrant.
Don't make excuses and Don't talk about it. Do it.
Don't use your past as an excuse, excuse your excuses and take action now!!!
I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took an excuse.
Some people use excuses to not accept responsiblity, others use excuses as a way to justify.
Don't look for excuses to lose. Look for excuses to win.
Excuses are used to justify leaving the scene of truth without changing.
Excuses are useless. Results are priceless.
If you don't want to do something, one excuse is as good as another.
I do not believe in excuses. I believe in hard work as the prime solvent of life's problems.
Any excuse will do when you need an excuse because it really doesn't matter. You won't be of much use to those who require people that get it done no matter what.
The only good excuse is that you have none.
If you really want to do it, you do it. There are no excuses.
For many people, an excuse is better than an achievement because an achievement, no matter how great, leaves you having to prove yourself again in the future, but an excuse can last for life.
Where the heart is willing it will find a thousand ways, but where it is unwilling it will find a thousand excuses.
There is always a perfectly good excuse, always a reason not to. The hardest freedom to win is the freedom from one's excuses.
We excuse our sloth under the pretext of difficulty.
Instead of excuses, take action; you'll be surprised how often you accomplish what you thought was difficult.
Don't do what you'll have to find an excuse for.
You can make excuses or you can get the job done, but you can't do both.
If you always make excuses to not follow through you deserve the weight of anxiety on your chest.
Never ruin an apology with an excuse.
When you're committed to something, you accept no excuses, only results.
If you really want to do something, you'll find a way. If you don't, you'll find an excuse.
It is wise to direct your anger towards problems. Not people. To focus your energies on answers. Not excuses.
We have forty million reasons for failure, but not a single excuse.
Today's excuses are tomorrow's regrets dressed in disguise.
Bad excuses are worse than none.
Two wrongs don't make a right, but they make a good excuse.
If it's important to you'll find a way. If it's not, you'll find an excuse.
No excuses. No explanations.
Uncalled for excuses are practical confessions.
Excuses are the crutches of the uncommitted.
You can have results or excuses. Not both.
Live with no excuses and love with no regrets.
Winners make commitments, losers make excuses.
Excuses cost a dime and that's why the poor could afford a lot of it.
